**<span class="team-name">Andrew Bolton</span>** <span class="team-title"> | Research Scientist</span>

<div style="display: flex; gap: 40px;">
  <div style="flex: 3;">
  Andrew's research bridges engineering, probabilistic programming and biological computation. He has identified [novel visual pathways](https://www.cell.com/cell-reports/fulltext/S2211-1247(15)01071-2), uncovered [computational principles of zebrafish vision,](https://www.cell.com/current-biology/fulltext/S0960-9822(22)01698-0) and [applied probabilistic programming techniques to describe visuomotor algorithms](https://elifesciences.org/articles/51975). Recently co-invented the SMCNN framework for [probabilistic neural computation](https://george.matheos.com/uploads/SNMC_preprint.pdf). PhD Brain and Cognitive Sciences (MIT).
  </div>
  <div style="flex: 1;">
  <img src="../assets/andrew.webp" alt="Andrew Bolton" style="width: 100%; height: auto; max-width: 120px;">
  </div>
</div>

**<span class="team-name">Matin Ghavami</span>** <span class="team-title"> | Research Scientist</span>

<div style="display: flex; gap: 40px;">
  <div style="flex: 3;">
  Matin [bridges](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=EWUUSKoAAAAJ&hl=en) programming languages and mathematics of probability. At the MIT Probabilistic Computing Project, he [co-developed probabilistic programming systems for 3D scene perception](https://arxiv.org/abs/2312.08715) and contributed to [inference strategies](https://proceedings.mlr.press/v206/lew23a.html) and [languages for probabilistic inference](https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3591290). BA Mathematics and BS EECS, Berkeley; Master Mathematics, Cambridge; PhD student, MIT.

**<span class="team-name">McCoy Becker</span>** <span class="team-title"> | Research Scientist</span>

<div style="display: flex; gap: 40px;">
  <div style="flex: 3;">
  McCoy is the main designer of the probabilistic programming system [GenJAX](https://genjax.gen.dev/), which in addition to being the primary modeling language of the MIT Probabilistic Computing Project, has been used to extend PPL use for [programmable variational inference](https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3656463). McCoy has extensive experience working in industry settings ([Charles River Analytics](https://cra.com/), [Beacon Biosignals](https://beacon.bio/), Google Research) on machine learning applications using deep learning.  PhD student, MIT.

# Scientific Collaborators

**<span class="team-name">Josh Tenenbaum</span>** <span class="team-title"> | Professor @ MIT</span>

<div style="display: flex; gap: 40px;">
  <div style="flex: 3;">
  Josh is a Professor of Computational Cognitive Science at MIT, Director of Science at the MIT Quest for Intelligence, and a Principal Investigator at CSAIL. His research seeks to reverse-engineer human intelligence by integrating cognitive science, neuroscience, and computer science, with a focus on how humans learn and reason from limited data. A MacArthur Fellow, he earned his PhD from MIT and co-leads the Center for Brains, Minds and Machines.
  </div>

</div>

# Advisors

**<span class="team-name">Sam Gershman</span>** <span class="team-title"> | Professor @ Harvard</span>

<div style="display: flex; gap: 40px;">
  <div style="flex: 3;">
  Sam is a Professor in the Department of Psychology and Center for Brain Science at Harvard. He serves as associate faculty at the Kempner Institute for the Study of Natural and Artificial Intelligence. His research focuses on computational cognitive neuroscience, aiming to understand how structured knowledge about the environment is acquired and utilized for adaptive behavior. He completed his Ph.D. in Psychology and Neuroscience at Princeton University.
